newsitem.title: EGYPT: Arab League to hold meeting at PLO call-official.
newsitem.headline: Arab League to hold meeting at PLO call-official.

text.p: The Arab League will hold an extraordinary meeting in Cairo on Tuesday in response to a PLO call to discuss the crisis in Middle East peacemaking, a senior Palestinian official said on Sunday.
"The meeting will definitely be held on Tuesday," PLO official Mohamed Subeih told Reuters. Arab League officials were not immediately available for comments.

The request comes after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's cabinet suspended peace talks with the Palestinian Authority and demanded a crack down on Moslem militants responsible for a double suicide bombing in a Jerusalem market on Wednesday that killed 15 people and wounded 170.

Israel also rounded up scores of suspected militants, closed off the West Bank and Gaza Strip, demanded the extradiction of the PLO police chief, and threatened to re-enter Palestinian self-rule areas to seize militants if Palestinian President Yasser Arafat failed to do the job.
On Saturday, Arafat discussed the crisis with Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak.
Egypt has been trying to help revive Israeli-PLO peacemaking from its four-month deadlock sparked by Netanyahu's groundbreaking on a Jewish settlement in Arab East Jerusalem.
